page.title: 15COBHAM MANOR RIDING CENTRE
page.content: The stables have been owned since 1984 by the Brumer family. The school is open every day except Monday. The busiest time is at the weekend. An adult class lesson costs Â£6 per hour or Â£6 for a half hour private lesson. A child's class lesson is Â£4.50. There are more than 50 horses, some owned and some liveried, cared for by 13 staff, 8 working pupils and 2 grooms. Riders range from beginners of 2 to elderly people. There are horses worth Â£4000 and Shetland ponies worth Â£50. The horses are shod about every 5 weeks by the farrier Keith Barker who lives locally. Tuition takes place at the school and there are hacks to the nearby Downs, picnic rides to Harrietsham and summer 'pub' rides to Hucking and Hollingbourne.
